newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius tourist arrivals up 17 pct in Q1 1997.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius tourist arrivals up 17 pct in Q1 1997.

text.p: The number of tourist arrivals in Mauritius rose 17 percent to 134,684 in the first quarter of this year from 115,349 in the same period in 1996, the tourism ministry said on Monday.
"The tourism sector continues on its positive trend. The last figures available show a favourable growth registered in tourist arrivals during the first quarter," the ministry said.
In the last quarter 1996, the number of tourist arrivals in Mauritius totalled 145,788, the ministry said.

The report showed in the first quarter of 1997, France accounted for 27 percent of arrivals, neighbouring French Reunion Island 18 percent, Germany 9.6 percent, South Africa 8.6 percent and Italy five percent.

Tourists arrivals in 1996 were 486,867 against 422,463 in 1995, an increase of 15.2 percent. Tourism receipts for 1996 were estimated at 9.05 billion rupees ($452.5 million), up 21 percent over 7.47 billion rupees in 1995.
Tourism is the third largest hard currency earner for Mauritius after sugar and manufactured products exports.
